intro: Borreria micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Americas, particularly found in regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Borreria micrantha is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
